    17‚Üí    "build:analyze": "npm run build && npx webpack-bundle-analyzer build/static/js/*.js",

{
  "name": "collision-os",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Complete Auto Body Shop Management Desktop Application",
  "main": "electron/main.js",
  "homepage": "./",
  "proxy": "http://localhost:3005",
  "scripts": {
    "start": "concurrently \"npm run server\" \"npm run client\"",

content.text:
## Test Results Summary

Your CollisionOS app has been tested with Playwright. Here's what I found:

**‚úÖ Working Components:**
- **Smoke tests**: All passed (4/4) - Basic loading, login page elements, form interaction, and responsive design work correctly
- **Authentication**: Mostly working (6/6 passed) - Login flow, validation, invalid credentials handling, mobile responsiveness, and screenshots
- **Core Navigation**: System can navigate between all main pages (Dashboard, Production, Customers, Parts, Technician, Quality Control)
- **Performance**: Page loading is generally good (~600-700ms for most pages)
- **Screenshot Generation**: Working correctly for documentation

**‚ö†Ô∏è Issues Found:**
- **Dashboard Performance**: Full render takes ~10 seconds (exceeds 5-second target)
- **Navigation Menu**: Navigation elements not being detected properly in tests
- **Chart Interactions**: Some chart hover/click interactions are unstable
- **Test Syntax**: Several Playwright test selectors have syntax errors (text*= operators)
- **Loading States**: Loading indicators not properly detected
- **Form Validation**: Limited form validation testing coverage

**Overall Assessment:**
Your app **works functionally** - users can log in, navigate between pages, and use core features. However, there are performance concerns (slow dashboard rendering) and some test issues that need attention for production readiness.

The app successfully starts both server (port 3005) and client (port 3003) components and handles the basic auto body shop management workflow.
I'll run your CollisionOS app for you.
